Reviews.Title: Not so happy now
Reviews.Author: R. Moore
Reviews.Content: Ordered and received via Amazon the 55 inch version. One nice feature with Amazon is that I could schedule the day I wanted the TV delivered since it was being sent to a second home in Florida and I did not want it delivered before I got there.Set up was easy, 3D worked fine without having to make any changes - it just takes the TV a few seconds to sync up correctly for 3D.  I ordered the glasses suggested by other reviewers and they work well - SSG-5100GB, just follow the instructions to get them to pair.  The picture to me is very good - I have an open room with a lot of light and glare, but don't have any issues with this TV.  TV keeps up well with fast action.  Sound for me is fine, but I am not looking for more than basic capability.  The only issue I had is with sound sync.  I found that when I turned the TV on before the DTV receiver, sound was out of sync.  If I turn the receiver on first, then the sound syncs fine.  Another reviewer on Best Buy site said he could not get the sound to stay in sync no matter what he did.  Curious if anyone else has experienced this problem.In summary, I did not want/need a smart TV and was not looking for 3D, but, did want a 55 inch TV for a second home.  To me, for the price, this TV is a real bargain.  I own 3 other Samsung TVs and have never had any problems with any of them - picture and sound on all of them fit my needs very well.**** Updated review.  Well, I encountered a problem that I would never expect, and that is both HDMI ports failed on this TV after about a month of light use.  The TV is in a Florida home and has been used for maybe 3 weeks at the most.  We were watching a show late last week when the TV lost signal and instructed us to check the source.  After turning everything off an on a couple of times, and checked my other TV to see if it was working (it was), I switched HDMI ports and everything was fine, for about 2 days and the second HDMI port failed.  I switched the Directv boxes around to see if it could be a problem with the box, but the other TV worked fine on both boxes, but the Samsung would not work on either box on either HDMI port.  Component works fine, but since I want to use HDMI, I am sending the TV back and will re-evaluate when I am coming back down to Florida.  I'd be curious if anyone else has ever experienced this type of problem.  It's disappointing since this TV is exactly what I was looking for - a large screen but not a Smart TV, the 3D was a bonus for me, and the price was right.

Reviews.Content: Everything about this tv is great. The picture. The 3D. It's almost perfect. The reason it gets 4 and not 5 stars is bc it only has 2 hdmi ports. Luckily I run everything through my receiver. But man. With all the technology this day and age only 2 hdmi ports is not enough unless u plan to plug and unplug often.

Reviews.Title: You don't need a wifi TV...
Reviews.Author: Owens8477
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent purchase. For $600 on a black Friday sale I was able to get 46", 120 refresh rate, 1080p, and reduced bezel. I find it funny that people will pay hundreds of extra dollars for a wifi tv when everything else that's connected to it already gives TVs that ability. Plus most tv's have horrendous UIs to navigate through.The pictures is excellent (no matter what tv you purchase be sure to look up picture calibration settings), it's super light (I mounted it on my own with very little effort), and it has a very slim bezel.The downside would be the lack of ports but if you know electronics or are any good at utilizing the Internet, you'll find simple work arounds.Paired with the surround sound system I bought this is a great addition to my living room. Delivery was as promised. I set up my system with a Twisted Vines hdmi cable,Google chromecast, and Samsung SSG-5100GB 3D glasses. If you have surround sound buy an audio fiber optics cable so you can enjoy 5.1 sound from the tv.

Reviews.Author: Joyce W Dreiling
Reviews.Content: I am pretty sure that I already rated this item once.  but I still love it.  No Complaints.  Nor more word needed

Reviews.Title: The best choice by far. Home Theater (Onkyo dolby surround 5.1 a/v receiver with mac mini, wiiu, blurry, cab box, raspberry pi)
Reviews.Author: Prefer-Cartoons-2-The-News
Reviews.Content: Ordered mine from Sears. 0% for 18 mos., as long as its paid in full by 18 mos.  This must be the single best LED 55" TV for the money.  The best screen, and picture quality. DARK BLACK, I MEAN BLACK!!  There is an adjustment for anything you want.  It has the highest quality possible, where its important.  You can have all the wireless fluff, if you connect the samsung usb dongle, but it had it where it counts. Decoding, and FABULOUS PICTURE!!  You can actually tell the difference between sources, and optics used in original recordings.  You get the filter settings to make everything look like a spanish soap opera, but it offers you the purity of just plain old picture quality.  A good screen will let you see the difference in sources' quality, and offer you the option of tweaking it to your liking.  Mine is connected to my Onkyo A/V Receiver, with a brand new Mac Mini, LG blu ray player, WiiU, and soon, my new Raspberry Pi!!  All via HDMI.  It communicates beautifully with all the components.  I do not have it connected to my home network with its own individual usb dongle, or its own ethernet jack, because everything else is, so its pointless, but for updating its software and firmware. Digital Optical audio output, (1), HDMI (2), component, plain RCA jacks, and a plain old 75 ohm cable tv input, ethernet jack (giant phone looking connection) and a usb port for its samsung wifi dongle, or it can view movies, pictures, or play music via an ntfs usb flash drive.  I am a tech davy person. A man child, a rugged geek.  My lucky wife, and I can't be happier.  I have scrutinized this thing, and I am so glad I chose this bad boy.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV if you are looking for a great picture and quality refresh rate
Reviews.Author: Andrew Stoudinger
Reviews.Content: Overall great TV that your getting here. I could care less about SmartTVs, and didn't care much for the fact that this is a 3D TV. The fact that it is a 3D means that it has to have a quality refresh rate to be able to produce high quality and smooth picture. Its great for gaming off my PC, and was a great price for the size, quality, and GHz. The only thing that I did not like about the TV is that it only had a PC audio OUT port, while most other TVs will have a PC audio IN port. Overall I got a great TV for a great price and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Content: nice picture, good features, update over internet, good 3d picture (you have to order glasses) about $40. uses ssg-3570cr 3d glasses from samsung. sound is as good as any..my only complaint is when plugging in  hdmi cable, that  back area is a little weak and pushs in some from pressure. but a great t.v.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV for the price
Reviews.Author: N. Deeter "ditter"
Reviews.Content: Here's the bottom line.  You can find higher quality TV's for sale.  You can find cheaper TV's for sale.  However, you're not going to find a TV that matches this exceptional quality for this kind of price.  Period.  This TV is fantastic.  Picture quality is very clear.  Blacks looks black (for the most part), and with some minor tweaking, there is very little, if any blur or "soap opera effect."  The 2 HDMI ports could be problem if you more than 3 HDMI devices.  But, for the money you save with this TV, you can afford to just unplug the one you aren't using.  I researched for over 6 months trying to find the right TV for the right price.  With the Samsung 6030, I found it.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Content: Initially I was skeptical about purchasing a tv online, without being able to see the picture, mess around on it, etc at a local store. I watched review after review. read pages and pages of reviews online, and even called a few local stores to get opinions, and was still skeptical about purchasing a tv online. I use my TV as a computer monitor, as well as movies, and tv. the picture is Fantastic! the 120 hz refresh rate, its noticeable when viewing movies and stuff online (certain things online). I can see the clarity, smoothness, and entirety of everything that's on the screen. I have always bought Samsung, and have never been disappointed. some reviews say the tv had defects, and dead pixels etc, but I personally do not have this problem. my picture is perfect! I would highly recommend this tv to anyone. I have yet to try the 3d, still waiting on the glasses to arrive, but will be anticipating the day!

Reviews.Author: David J. Forrester
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, Like some I found it a bit tedious to find the game more on this tv you would assume it would be with all the other formats but it's hidden away in a completely different area of the menu. But this is the only flaw Ive found with the TV. I bought this model because it did not have a smart function like most TV's seem to have, given that I have a p3 and a Sony blurry entertainment center I have little use for another device that provides the same function. Not to mention I find that the more complex a device the more likely it's going to have issues. It took a little tweaking to get the picture where I wanted but after I did I totally noticed a difference between this TV and the Toshiba 40 inch I had before this that was only a 60hz TV. I was amazed at how lite this tv is, it makes for an easy move is you need to find a different place to place it. Over all I would definitely recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: Awesome! great quality for a good price, beautiful display.
Reviews.Author: miss.sarah
Reviews.Content: I just got this tv (upgrading to 55in from an older Samsung 32in model) and I'm in love with it.  Truly a beautiful display--- you *must* immediately turn off that pesky Auto Motion Plus setting under Picture Options to get rid of the infamous "Soap opera effect"; then it looks fantastic.  Other reviewers have listed additional ways to customize but I found the Auto Motion setting was the most important right out of the box-- everything else is mostly dependent on your preferences and how dark/bright your room is.  I think the "Amplified" sound setting sounds best as well.The 3D thing isn't really important to me but it's kinda fun to have I guess.  If I didn't already have a wii/ps3/smart blu-ray player then I'd have opted for the more expensive smart-tv model because netflix is a must, but I can easily use my other devices for that.Overall, I think this is an excellent choice for someone looking for a relatively inexpensive upgrade to their home entertainment center.  I should say that I'm partial to Samsung in regards to tv's because my whole family has had them over the years and they have all held up over the test of time.  Quality is important to me and I've never been disappointed thus far.Additionally, I used the Cheetah flush tilt wall mount (link listed below) and it worked great-- *just* enough room for the hdmi/component cables in the back and looks great, seems sturdy.  Not that I'd encourage it, but I was able to mount the tv by myself even though I'm a paltry 5'1" but it took all my core body strength and I almost thought I wasn't going to be able to do it, lol.  Two people would be the smart way to go on that.Cheetah wall mount: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0012S4APK/ref=oh_details_o03_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1

Reviews.Content: Glad I purchased the HDMI cables: none come with the set.  Cabinet space was limited and the set fit just right. No problem installing it and works perfectly as advertised.  Still not sure about 3D but bought and synchronized 3 pairs of glasses just in case! There is a 3D mode for the image with which certain parts of the image appears slightly blurry without the glasses but the 3D effect with the glasses has not totally convinced me yet. Great image quality in general though.  Not sure how effective is the 120Hz but did not notice any blur when fast motion in picture so this should be fine. I wouldn't settle for less anyway. Great feature: always play a show in the native and best fitting format without need for adjustment. More than enough connections possibilities although I haven't tried them all yet! Delivered from Amazon just in time as promised. To me this is the best ratio quality/price.  I would highly recommend this item to anyone with limited space and eager for great image quality.

Reviews.Content: The color and reception with this TV is very good and more than what I expected. I also liked the price and the quick delivery.

Reviews.Title: I love my newTV
Reviews.Author: Big Howdy - "Audioster"
Reviews.Content: Well, finally took the plunge and updated our 10yr old trinitron...we have had plenty of time to figure out what we liked, what we didnt, and how much we wanted to pay. Waiting till Amazons black friday sale this year, netted us a 55in for $699 !! Man o man, bigger truly is better. Purchase / deiivery / set up was painless. The picture is fantastic, but plan on spending an afternoon tinkering with it, to dial in what you like. Theres more options than we needed, especially the 240 trumotion setting...its just plain weird. Its like watching old soap operas, the way the images pan across the screen.  The DLNA server works much better than the Visio we tried, but ultimately we went with the WD live box for file sharing. Remote is laid out well, and it works well with our new Samsung 5900 BluRay player. Cant really comment on the 3D, still looking for a deals on content, and glasses yet, but, Im all set up to cut the cord now....satellite tv can kiss me arse

Overall, a great selection for my family and a good value.

Reviews.Content: it is a very good picture with out the 3d turned on  I would recommend it to anyoneTom Gimbert

Reviews.Title: Needed a replacement TV for under 1K
Reviews.Author: J. Vachon "noob"
Reviews.Content: This exceeded all expectations. Packaging was fine as it arrived by truck...free with Amazon Prime..........Setup was easy. Plugged it into existing space where my previous big screen (46" Sharp" sat and I am more than happy.Network set itself up with that DHCP. Reviews.Title: The best HDTV in our house
Reviews.Author: Too Tall "Tax & Car Guy"
Reviews.Content: We have two older HDTVs, both 46", and this one uses a lot less electricity, rated at $11 per year on the energy sticker, it weighs less, and this UN40FH6030FXZA gives a better picture. I received it as a gift and it replaces a heavier 2006 Dell 32" 720p HDTV in my home office. The Dell 720p TV worked well as a TV until the remote receiver failed and disabled any remote from controlling it, and it projected text off a computer spreadsheet with too much fuzziness, although pictures projected OK. This UN40FH6030 TV is far superior at projecting both HDTV from a cable box via HDMI port as well as pictures and text, such as from an Excel worksheet, when hooked up via HDMI port to my laptop. I've only had it since Christmas 2013, so I will update the review as needed. It has two HDMI ports, and more would be better, but two is adequate for me right now.

Reviews.Title: Arrived defective, working on sending it back now
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this is a great TV. I have the 2012 model (2 actually!) of this TV and I love it. This particular one arrived defective with horizontal green lines occupying the bottom 1/3rd of the screen with lots of artifacting and jittering of the picture, even when the cable box wasn't plugged into the TV. Be it white noise screen or pure black, the screen was acting defective. When the screen was pure black, the screen would cycle through being black, grey and white for a half second each. I quickly ruled out the issue being the cable box and proceeded to call Amazon Customer Service. It was about a 5 minute phone call and the result was the delivery company being notified that they had to pick the TV up and that we'd be notified within a business day of a good time to pick it up. Also, the guy said that a replacement was already on the way. I left satisfied and within the next 2 weeks I should have the replacement. I'll update this as needed and highlight the rest of this experience accordingly.EDIT: Back to 5-star review. It took a couple weeks but I finally got my replacement. It's working perfectly fine and doesn't have any of the aforementioned defects. Highly recommend this TV thanks to Amazon's wonderful Customer Service!

Reviews.Title: Good for the price, awesome picture
Reviews.Author: Xandra Cohen
Reviews.Content: Shipping: Enhanced shipping - two people delivered it up to my 3rd floor apartment, I signed for it, and they left. They didn't offer to unpack it for me or remove the box (I would have declined the offer anyway).TV Pros: After I followed some of the suggested setting adjustments from previous reviewers, the picture is awesome (colors are good and sharp [I upgraded from a standard TV, so I might not be the expert on picture]). Tried the 3D a little, but would like to wait until I get the glasses to make a decision on that.TV Cons: Maybe I just didn't install the stand correctly, but I feel like it doesn't have the most sturdy base. I'll just barely touch the TV and it will rock back and forth slightly for a couple seconds before it stops moving (kind of like a giant bobble head, but not that dramatic of a shake, you can't notice it when you're sitting and watching the TV).Overall, I have no regrets, especially for the $699 that I paid :)

Reviews.Title: Our new HDTV

Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound.  We are very happy with this new HDTV.  Mounted with Cheetah mount in our new home.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Linda Segers
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great value.  The picture is fantastic.  The only negative is the 3d viewing.  It's not as accurate as my LG plasma but then again, it's no where near as expensive.

Reviews.Title: Digital 3D TV Excellence
Reviews.Author: H. Schulte
Reviews.Content: I have had good experiences with Samsung electronics before - projection TV, amplifiers and so on.  With that background, I had high expectations of this 46inch TV before I received it.  Samsung has done it again for me.  The resolution is excellent, color control is as I expected.  If I had one thing to criticize, it would be the sound from the TV itself.  That has been taken care of with a base woofer and sound bar.  The 3D is OK to very good, but I expect that to improve with newer models, too.

Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to replace a 40" Samsung TV. The picture is quite amazing, I tried the 3D and that is awesome as well. I didn't want a smart TV as I use Roku for that purpose. Delivery was by UPS, received TV in one day from Amazon.The price was better then any department store. If your looking for a 46" TV this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Too many issues within the first 3 months...wish i bought another brand!

Reviews.Content: Issues that I had with this tv within the first 3 months;picture kept going out. repaired twice already!motion blur and judder while watching sports.hdmi port 1 went badNot sure how long this tv will last, yet I will not buy a Samsung again. Their CS is just as bad as Vizio ;/

Reviews.Title: Does everything I need it to....which means "watching television"!
Reviews.Author: Logical Thinker
Reviews.Content: I just don't need the whiz-bang features of the more fancy TVs, with a dozen inputs and such.  I don't game, I don't stream, I just watch cable and DVDs, simple as that.So, this television does that perfectly.  Picture is great, sound is better than other LCDs I've owned for watching basic shows and news. For movies and such, I augment the sound with my stereo using the "Audio Out" connection (which is an annoying 3.5mm plug, by the way).  Angled viewing is fine, and the controller receiver (which is somewhere on the set) gets signals just fine from a pretty severe angle (like when you're diving for the mute button to answer the phone).Anyway, it's a great basic television set!  No issues for me.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected which is always a good thing!
Reviews.Author: Robert Payne
Reviews.Content: Paid almost $100 less than this sold for in stores around here. Liked that it did not have all the extra bells and whistles (SMART TV crud) just enough input/output ports and great specifications.The picture quality is great and the 3D effects are stunning. Watched Pacific Rim (not the best movie I know) on a regular Samsung 46" LED TV and it was okay but then watched the 3D version on this new set and was blown away by the effects. Looking forward to getting some more 3D movies to immerse myself in. On a side note, I am also using this set as a monitor for my computer with stellar results as well. I would suggest though that one should also link it with separate audio system as the internal speakers are okay but not adequate for a good movie experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!
Reviews.Author: Randy Pettigrew
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good. It is only a 40 inch but it is all that I wanted for the size room that it is in.The color is very good and the sound is better that I expected.

Reviews.Title: for the price, it's a steal
Reviews.Author: Dangerous Dirk "$"
Reviews.Content: Ok, I won't pretend to be a videophile (if there is such a thing, spell check says there is not) but I spend a TON of time watching TV, mostly HD cable, and I play a lot of video games.  This TV will not be used for gaming, however, only TV/Movies in a room with a fair amount of windows/daylight.  It is replacing a 55" sony LCD non-thin TV that I bought in 2006 that just wasn't bright enough for the application (and too large, dimensionally).In the short amount of time that I have used this TV, I am impressed.  For under $800, this TV was delivered free (thanks Amazon) and was also unboxed and setup on the stand for no extra fee.  this is not related to the product, but still notable.the picture is crisp and sharp, and you don't have a lot of extra stuff to pay for that you won't use (smart TV stuff) although it is nice to know that there is an option of a USB network adapter in the event that I want to connect to Wi-Fi and stream stuff.  I won't mention these features, since I haven't used them and am not familiar. Same goes with the 3d stuff, not something that interests me, so I probably won't use it.setup was pretty easy, and I haven't tweaked the picture settings yet, but it looks pretty good right out of the box.  I haven't really noticed any negatives yet, but will be sure to update this review if I come across some.well done Samsung, you have kicked Sony out as the #1 TV in this house, and I even have a Samsung laptop now as well.for the money, you cannot beat this TV.

Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a thin LED 40" 1080p 120Hz TV then consider this one, even if you could care less about the 3d rubbish its a good TV, picture is clear and colours are vivid and motion is smooth.what more can I say, its just lovely.my one complaint is that the stand doesn't twist, but not a deal breaker.Love this thing, shame it wont work in Europe when we all move back there next year..Oh well.. guess I will have to buy another one there!

Reviews.Title: Amazing clarity and performance!
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I was able to pick this up for a great price and it was really the perfect fit for me. I was in the market for a new T.V. and I had kept my eye on this particular TV, and once the price dropped to a more affordable price for me I grabbed it! Samsung has always been a reliable brand for me so I did a ton of research on this TV before I decided this was the one for me.Out of the box I do believe that this TV does require some minor tweaking. I spent a good hour messing around with the color settings, as well as the brightness settings, and even the presets. I was having an issue where the screen would sort of glitch out on me from time to time so I took to the reviews here on amazon and thankfully one of the top reviews actually had a fix for me. Apparently there is a setting called 'Auto Motion Plus' which can be found under the 'Picture Options'. This immediately removed the error and I have not had any issues since.I've had this TV for almost 6 months now and I could not be happier with my purchase. The TV is still running great, and I have had no issues.I highly recommend this TV to anyone looking for quality performance at an affordable price!

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever Owned!

Reviews.Content: Def recommend this TV.Wall Mounted.HD looks great.Connects to my PC via Chromecast.I wish I bought one sooner!

Reviews.Title: Extremely happy

Reviews.Content: Fantastic product and super price.Perfect size for my room and the quality of the picture is outstanding. Very, very easy to set up. Great audio.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great price, big screen, good picture, and 3D. Save money and get your smarts from blue ray or chromecast!
Reviews.Author: JFrey
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm happy with my purchase. As another reviewer said I think this model was priced appropriately for a large screen capable of 3D without the smart TV stuff. I bought it because I wanted at least a 55" screen, but to stay under $1,000 and still be able to try out the 3D. I figured I needed a 3D blue ray which has all the smart TV capability anyway. I also already owned a chromecast which has most of the smart stuff I wanted and is getting better every day. So I'm glad I was able to save a few bucks and still get a nice big screen with 3D.The picture quality is very sharp. Colors are bright and vibrant. The backlit LED stays nice and bright in a room with lots of windows. I would say the only negatives are only two HDMI ports and the off angle viewing isn't the best but that's hard to compare against other models unless you actually put it in the room in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for every day use
Reviews.Author: BRANDON MILLER
Reviews.Content: When I saw such a great deal on a TV on was very skeptical, I did some research and strongly felt this TV would suit what I needed. I had to adjust colors a little but once that was figured out it was smooth sailing. The only down side is the lack of buttons on the side or bottom of the TV for manual use, but when you land a deal like this who cares just keep track of your remote.

Reviews.Content: Perfect size for my living space. Clarity of picture is excellent. Menu choices for screen and options adjustments logically designed and categorized; description of each choice apt and concise.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Robert V Blaine
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this TV.  I also visited some stores to better view the available options.  I chose this 40" Samsung because it was the best value I could find.  I did not want a smart TV, but I wanted the option for 3-D when available.  This TV also fits my cabinet in the hearth room.After tweaking the picture periodically for about a week, I chose the default settings for most everything on the picture except the back light.  I reduced the back light setting from default, and found the picture to be extraordinary.  I am more than satisfied with the TV and look forward to years of good viewing.  Only downside so far is the available connections on the back of the unit, but they're satisfactory.

Reviews.Content: The tv color and clarity are superb.  The tv is stripped down on function without video streaming interfaces or sophisticated menus.  As one who runs such things through my play station anyway those functions were not missed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect

Reviews.Content: The warehouse pricing was very competitive.  I liked the picture quality without all the Smart tech. and extra price it entailed.

Reviews.Title: Great!

Reviews.Content: I ordered this during the black friday deals. As others have noted there is a huge "soap opera" look that you most definitely will want to turn off. The sound is better than my previous Insignia. The delivery was fantastic. They scheduled a 2 hour window so I didn't have to wait around all day, and set everything up for me, tested and confirmed that I was satisfied before leaving.

Reviews.Title: What to say....I love it!

Reviews.Content: I got this to replace my 51 inch Hitachi rear projection 1080i tv because the screen is starting to mess up with anything that is using the HDMI input (the ONLY input I use). I almost bought many other tvs both locally and on the internet before I chose this one and I am amazed. It is light weight, it has amazing picture, the 3D was not what I cared about in buying a tv but i knew I didnt want a smart tv because I have it hooked up to my computer and my XBOX 360, and I am much more impressed with the 3D than I thought I would be. I have not spent the $20-$30 on any of the calibration discs yet, I was able to get it looking great with settings I found in a forum. I am very happy with this purchase and I hope it lasts a long time because it is the nicest tv I have ever watched!

Reviews.Content: We were amazed when we saw the picture for the first time. WOW! I haven't figured out yet how the 3d works, but just the regular picture is really great. And the size is perfect for over our fireplace.

Reviews.Content: the quality of this TV is exactly what I expected infected so good I've been using it for my computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: This TV is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: My dad bought this as a gift for us and I absolutely LOVE it! It has an amazing picture compared to our Sony flat screen TV. As others mentioned in their reviews, they weren't too keen on the auto motion effect ("soap opera effect"), but after having it off for a while, I turned it back on and I love it. I did make some adjustments to the settings, but I won't touch on that because so many others have done a great job saying how to do that in their reviews. What some might not know regarding 3D TVs, the quality of the 3D picture has more to do with how well the 3D movie was made, not necessarily how great the TV is. I've watched Monster's University in 3D, but they didn't do a great job with their 3D effects, so it really doesn't even pertain to this TV review. Awesome TV though! My dad's money was well-spent on this TV. ;)

IF you want the best then this TV doesn't qualify, Go and spend thousands if you want the very best, but for the price on this model your getting a very good TV.You cannot beat the VALUE of this 3D ready TV

Reviews.Title: Another great set from Samsung
Reviews.Author: Nick Panaccio
Reviews.Content: I've been a Samsung guy since their first LED set, and still own an older LED DLP that's running strong, so it was a no-brainer for me to go with Samsung when looking to replace the dying Toshiba LCD in my bedroom after looking at the competition. I narrowed down my choices to this set and the Vizio M401i-A3. While the Vizio was less expensive, it simply cannot compete with the quality of the Samsung. They've been in the game for a long time and have a proven track record.The funny thing to me was that I had no intention of buying a 3D TV, and have no intention of ever using that feature. I chose this model because it had better components than some of the other Samsung sets that are classified as a "Smart TV", and it's priced lower. So, if you're looking for a 40" LED TV, and don't need the smart features - most of which are useless, IMO - this is a great option for you.

Reviews.Title: PHENOMINAL TV
Reviews.Author: John Irons
Reviews.Content: What a Bargain! Paid more for a 40 inch LCD 4 years ago! Picture cannot be beat. However, all TV's are source dependent. What does that mean? It simply means that picture and SOUND quality is dependent on your signal supplier, being Cable, Satelite, etc.Signal source problems have been the main cause of poor TV performance. Besides, source variations, i.e. different channels, 1080 HD vs 750 HD (most standard broadcast channels) makes a big difference in picture quality. Too many consumers blame the product when its the signal quality. Its the same as buying a high performance auto and then puting cheap gas in it, and wonder why it doesn't live up to its performance specs.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 20 minutes and then the capacitors failed. Buyer Beware.
Reviews.Author: Sean Kearney
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung HDTV and I have to say it was great when it worked for the first 20 minutes.After picking it up at Best Buy I drove home to set it up. Placing the stand on the TV was rather simple, but even after installing it, the stand felt somewhat flimsy. Not a big deal for me.Powered up the TV and went through the setup steps; again very simple.Plugged my brother's PS4 into the TV and started gaming on it. Picture and sound quality was very nice, there were a few problems with the Samsung's auto dimming settings, which made the picture look very dark, but I was able to find the option rather quickly and turned it off.So everything was going fine for about 15-20 minutes and then the picture when completely black... then turned back on... then went black again. Thinking it was maybe a faulty HDMI port I switch ports and switched the source to the second port. No go.Tried switching out the HDMI cable with another one. Again no go. I then figured out (after seeing the Samsung symbol appearing after the blackouts) that this seemed like a power issue.Tried turning the TV off for a bit. This seemed to help for a few minutes after turning the TV back on, but after 5 minutes or so the power started switching on and off again.Turns out this is an issue A LOT of Samsung TVs have and is caused by the types of capacitors Samsung uses. For most people it seems to occur soon after the warranty runs out for the TV. I guess lucky for me it happened after the first 20 minutes.[...]Will be returning this unit for a full refund and will probably steer clear of Samsung TVs until this issue is addressed.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV, Cannot believe no 3d glasses were included!
Reviews.Author: J. A. Chen "Loss4words"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Tv to replace a 3 year old Sharp Aquos I gave away because it was such absolute garbage and I wanted a 3D TV.  Setup was easy and fast and accomplished in about 10 minutes once out of the box. The TV is decent looking on the stand with a reasonably thin profile and bezel.  I have it on a stand but again, the relatively thin profile means it would not be an intrusive piece of furniture if one decided to hang it on the wall.  The picture quality is excellent with sharp, clear images that transition smoothly without any blurring or pixelation.  The colors are rich, vibrant and realistic and there are plenty of customizable adjustments to get just the look you want with an intuitive interface.  Even the remote is well laid out with 1-button access to all major functionality people will want like switching from 2D to 3D, changing scene types, etc.My only few gripes are the "only" 2 HDMI jacks and that no 3D glasses are included in the box.  Also, the sound adjustments are a bit limited (as opposed to the plethora of picture adjustments) which is disappointing.  The other TV I considered was the similarly priced LG-55LS4600 which has 3 HDMI jacks and 4 pairs of 3D glasses included.  Other similar TVs I considered from "good" brands like Panasonic and Sony were more expensive (no, I do not consider Vizio, Sharp, Hi-Sense, Westinghouse, etc, good brands).

Reviews.Title: Awesome 46" LED TV from Amazon
Reviews.Author: PhilUSAFRet "Jewelry Hobbyist, Italian cooking"
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, I chose this model and I chose to purchase this TV from Amazon.  I got the best price along with free shipping.  It arrived quickly and in perfect shape.  It was easy to assemble, easy to hook up, and with only a few looks at the online manual, easy to set up.  It's a new model and has all the features I will ever need.  Picture, colors, etc. all clear, rich, and easy to adjust to personal tastes.  Not impressed with the speakers though (treble too harsh), so I bought sound bar from Amazon to go with it (see my review for Pyle Pro PSVB200BT 300W Bluetooth Sound Bar). Overall, for less than $800, I don't think you can find a better TV.  Amazon gave me free Technical Support and Samsung extended my factory warranty.  Lots of hookups for techies. Have been enjoying it for a few months now and have not regretted my decision.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture
Reviews.Author: Brian P "Brian P"
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is great - more on that in a moment.  I was not impressed with Enhanced Delivery of the TV.  One delivery person arrived and the box was too big for him so I had to help lift the box into the house.  Then he was going to leave before the TV was checked to make sure it was OK but I asked him to stay so I could check the TV.  The delivery person did then help me lift the TV out of the box so I could plug it in and make sure  the screen was not broken but I guess I was just expecting more from Enhanced Delivery.  I am not deducting any stars for this as it is not directly related to the product itself.No real complaints with the TV itself.  It has a bright, clear, vibrant picture.  I have not tried 3D so can't comment on that aspect.  Some people have complained that the screen is too glossy or can cause a glare.  The screen on my TV has almost a completely matte finish so there is little to no glare which is important to me as the TV is in a bright room with a large window close to the TV. The sound from the speakers is loud enough but does sound somewhat flat no matter what you set the equalizer to - this is to be expected with the small speakers in flat screen TV's.  I got a soundbar to go along with the TV which makes a big improvement in the sound.I reviewed TV's in several showrooms before deciding on this one.  I prefer the direct lit LED in this model vs the edge lit LED in some of the other models.  In every showroom, at least for my preferences, the Samsung models always had the best picture, usually by quite a bit over the other name brands like Sony, Panasonic, Vizio and LG.

Reviews.Content: Great TV so for no problems.  Clear vivid picture.  We have not had any concerns with it. Sound is also good.

Reviews.Title: GRRRREAT! First TV ;D
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I did not buy this TV because of the 3D feature. I don't care for 3D, I just liked how it wasn't a smart TV. I already have an Xbox so having preinstalled apps on my television would be pointless. Anyways, I'm twenty and still hadn't purchased my first TV. So there was a lot to consider but the size (40") is perfect. I love the square stand that it rests on and the audio and picture quality are just right (I do use an HDMI cable to connect my Xbox). I didn't have to change any of the settings that most people did to make it work for them. Watching Big Bang Theory or How I Met Your Mother looked fine and the casts didn't look soap opera-like, like some people were complaining about. I only use my Xbox with this, so I have no idea what cable or satellite would look like picture quality-wise. Not only that, this TV is ridiculously light weight. I swear, it only feels like 20 lbs, which is great because it's really easy to move it when me and my friends do LAN parties. Which reminds me, that's the reason why I bought it with 120Hz because I play a lot of video games. Anywho! Pick the TV that works for you! Take your time, I sat on my decision for a solid two weeks before I finally made my choice and it never hurts to look at reviews or look on YouTube/Google for more information on what you're buying. Only downsides might be that I wish now it had more HDMI ports. I think it only has two because I got a Chrome Cast and now all my ports are used up. Still love this TV though regardless. Oh! And one more thing, I got a pretty nice discount buying from Amazon Warehouse Deals because whoever had it before me only unboxed it and then sent it back and that shaved a good $50 bucks off the price if I remember correctly.

I contacted amazon tech support and we changed the HDMI cable, released the static charge by holding the power button, turned off all timers and reset the uverse box. All to no avail, still happens every other day. Very frustrating, I love the TV and do not want to go through the hassle of returning and getting another one, but now have to live with this. Reviews.Content: Picture wise, this tv's great, once you figure out how to turn off the soap opera effect. There's enough options here to please the average tv viewer. Those that consider themselves quality snobs can probably find something to nit pick about. The only issues I have are the sound, the remote, and the inputs/outputs. The sound as with most LCD, led, & plasmas is a issue. But hopefully the soundbar I'm getting this week will address that issue. The sound problem is really all about the dialogue. The other sounds all come in just fine or really loud. My sound prob may be worse than it is for others, cause my tv's almost directly in front of my loud air conditioner. Some buttons on the remote feel awkwardly placed in comparison to others. As for connections, this new tv has a lot less connections than my last Samsung LCD from about 4 years ago. This limits greatly what I can have connected to tv & I'm not an all in one kinda a guy. I like having a roku, & a blu-ray. I do most of my gaming on another set. Despite all this I still feel like this is 4 star tv. The speakers project sound to the rear so if you mount your set on a wall that may the sound issues. And there plenty of cheap or high end remotes that can replace the one included. Can't say anything bout 3D features cause I have no use for it. I'm a bit peaved that the price dropped twice since I bought it less than a month ago & is now a full $100 dollars less.

Reviews.Author: frugalbuyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV 1 1/2 years ago. At first I was very happy, but recently the TV started turning off on its own in the middle of watching and then it would turn on again. More like they didn't want to have to explain it to their bosses that they damaged the tv (you could easily see the cracks on the screen once you took the tv out of the box).I ended up buying the same TV at Best Buy for $80 more.  :-(  I needed it for the superbowl you see.TV itself is great.  Clear and smooth picture for movies and sports.  Great color too.  I don't really like the 3-D image as it hurts my eyes so I think I have some adjusting to do still.

Reviews.Title: Top notch picture and great contrast levels
Reviews.Author: Yoshi
Reviews.Content: I at first purchased the Vizio 55 3d and Samsung bluray 3d player. The Vizio was not up to par of my 2 year old Samsung LCD 240hz b750. So I returned it. Seen this set but it wasn't on display. Knowing my Samsung at home was still I impressive and this set was affordable. I made the jump. No regrets.now for my settings. These are not calibrated. I just like a very popping picture. Also I have the 55 model and every tv is different.I like the soap opera effect as long as there is no to little Blur. I like the crisp loom it gives. These settings are for that type of picture. They are also for a tv in a bright room most of the day.Standard setting.Brightness 20Contrast 100Color 55Sharp 45Dynamic contrast highBlack tone darkestGamma +1Color tone standardAuto motion standard.The gamma +1 is important to help the ghosting. These settings have eliminated ghosting on my set. It's even better than my actual 240hz set.Yes it looks like the soap opera effect but it is the best damn picture you will see from this set. If you like that look. If not this will not be for you at all.Watching dark knight truly is a pleasure. Avatar all looked marvelous. If anyone out these has some more settings please share. Enjoy the tv everyone!

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG IS THE BEST

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Hye Young
Reviews.Content: I bought a cheaper.Quality is good. Samsung is good too.My husband is fond of the TVgood good~

Reviews.Title: Great TV, slightly overpriced
Reviews.Author: socksman
Reviews.Content: Got as a gift for parents, they seem to enjoy so I will rate this accordingly. Not much more, probably overpriced but you're paying for the brand.

Reviews.Title: so far so good

Reviews.Title: Its a huge tv omg

Reviews.Title: Hate it!
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised at all of the positive reviews for this TV.  In my experience, it has the worst picture quality of any TV I have ever owned.  The white balance is so far off that it is nearly impossible for it to display a realistic skin tone.  I have been battling with this TV for about two weeks now trying every combination of settings imaginable to attain a decent picture, but it does not seem possible without springing for a professional calibration.The set has four color tones available including Cool, Standard, Warm1, and Warm2.  Unfortunately, none of them offer a neutral white balance.  Of the color tones available, Standard should be the closest to neutral, but instead it has a very heavy red saturation.  Consequently, skin tones are way too red, and no matter what I do to reduce or counteract this, the rest of the picture suffers.  Unfortunately, the other color tones are no better.  Cool has a heavy blue saturation, while Warm1 is very yellow, and Warm2 is practically tan.  The menu does include a white balance control, but it is pretty much useless.  Even with the red turned all the way down, the skin tones are still far too red.Aside from the terrible picture quality, I was very disappointed to find out that when using the optical output, Dolby Digital is only available while watching live TV.  The audio for all HDMI sources is output as 2 channel PCM.  That's an unforgivable loss of fidelity.  Fortunately, I was able to work around the problem by routing the audio through an optical switch rather than the TV, but that was a huge pain because my previous TV was able to output Dolby Digital no matter which source I was watching.I mainly purchased the TV for its 3D capabilities, and I have to say that in that respect, it did not disappoint.  Some people have complained that the TV does not come with any 3D glasses, but I look at that as a bonus because I do not like the design of Samsung's 3D glasses, so by not including them, Samsung saved me some money on the cost of the TV, and I was able to purchase some non-Samsung 3D glasses which worked very well for me.The bottom line is that I really wanted to love this TV, but unfortunately, I have come to hate it because of its poor picture quality, so I would not recommend it to anyone under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: Shipping Nightmare!
Reviews.Author: mp
Reviews.Content: Our experience was a nightmare from beginning to end.  We were given various times for delivery and on the first attempt, no one showed up to deliver the item and to compound that, no one called.  One wasted day.  Then after complaining about this, we got another window of time that the TV could come.  They gave us a three day window with no time frame and the status said that the issue was on us.  That we needed to contact the shipping company.  We finally got a call the second day into the new 3 day window.  The call was late at night so we had no option of returning the call that evening.  The caller did leave a voice mail telling us that now they need to change from the 3 day window to the following weekend with a time range of 8am-2pm.  This date was more than a week after the guaranteed delivery date.  All in all, we never got the TV delivered as we couldn't wait unit the following week appointment to deliver the TV.  This experience was the worst that I have ever had with Amazon and leaves me wondering if I can ever buy anything from them again.  No one took responsibility for this issue and they both pushed the blame to the other side.  Even though we never got the TV, Amazon wouldn't refund our money until they got the TV back from the shipping company.  You have to wonder about that.  We never had it, yet we have to wait until they get the TV back in another week or so.I would just say to beware if you buy a TV from Amazon as the shipping nightmare wasn't readily available on the reviews, but the shipping company CEVA had horrible reviews everywhere.  Of course, I didn't know this until I was caught in the middle of this nightmare.

Reviews.Title: Need to replace LCD panel after 4.5 years of light use
Reviews.Author: dongurao
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review knowing that it is for a different Samsung TV model but I think my points are relevant. I bought a Samsung 55-inch LED TV model UN55B7000WFXZA in 2009. After about 4.5 years of very light use (The TV is in my media room and mostly used only when we watched movies), last week, it started displaying overlapping double images on the top quarter of the screen. I requested repair service from Samsung, agreeing to pay the service charge ($70 for visit and diagnosis). Service person came and told me that the LCD panel needs to be replaced. Estimated cost is $1200!!! I called Samsung, explained the situation, and asked their help to mitigate the repair cost. Samsung said "too bad". The warranty expired so they won't help. I know the warranty is only 1 year but should I just swallow the fact that the TV I paid a couple of thousand dollars for lasted only 4 years? And repair costs as much as buying a new one? It's ridiculous. As automobile manufactures do for power-train, TV manufacturers should provide longer warranty for the most critical and expensive parts like the LCD panel. I have many Samsung products including another 52-inch Samsung LCD TV, Galaxy Note tablet, smartphone, etc. but I'm done with buying Samsung products, at least Samsung TV's. I'd give a 0 star rating if I could.
